DataElement.preferredName: Lymphoma Relapse Biopsy Proven Remission Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the yes/no indicator if a relapse biopsy proven lymphoma occurred following remission.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lymphoma Recurrent Disease Biopsy Established Next Remission Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas._The return of a disease after a period of remission._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._Shown to be valid beyond a reasonable doubt._Subsequent; immediately following in time or order._An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease)._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites.  This category includes Non-Hodgkin's lymphomas and Hodgkin's lymphomas. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Property.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Biopsy Established Next Remission Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:Shown to be valid beyond a reasonable doubt.:Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.:An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Shown to be valid beyond a reasonable doubt.
Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.
An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves
